net.varkhan.base.extensions
Class Reflect

java.lang.Object
  net.varkhan.base.extensions.Reflect

public final class Reflect
extends java.lang.Object

Reflection tools

Reflexive object structure examination, and heap monitoring tools.

Author:
varkhan

Nested Class Summary
static class Reflect.Ref<Type>
          A reference to an object.
static interface Reflect.Visitor<P>
          A visitor callback used in the #visit(Class, String, Object, Object) and Reflect.Visitor.visit(Class, String, Object, Set, Object) methods.
static class Reflect.VisitorState
          The return status of a Reflect.Visitor callback used in the #visit(Class, String, Object, Object) and #visit(Class, String, Object, Set, Object) methods.

Method Detail

sizeclass

public static long sizeclass(java.lang.Class<?> cls)
Returns the number of bytes used by a primitive type.

Parameters:
cls - the primitive type class
Returns:
the number of bytes used in memory by the type represented by the argument class

sizeof

public static long sizeof(java.lang.Object obj)
Computes the size of a particular class of objects, discarding any contribution from objects already in the reference context.

Parameters:
obj - the object
Returns:
the size, in bytes, of the object

sizeof

public static long sizeof(java.lang.Object obj,
                          java.util.Set<Reflect.Ref<java.lang.Object>> ctx)
Computes the size of a particular class of objects, discarding any contribution from objects already in the reference context.

Parameters:
obj - the object
ctx - the reference context (or null if no context should be used)
Returns:
the size, in bytes, of the object

visit

public static <P> boolean visit(java.lang.Object obj,
                                Reflect.Visitor<P> vis,
                                P par)
Calls a visitor for every field of an object

Parameters:
obj - the object
vis - the visitor
par - a control parameter passed as last argument to the visitor
Returns:
true if the visitor never returned a FAIL status, false otherwise
See Also:
Reflect.Visitor, Reflect.VisitorState

visit

public static <P> boolean visit(java.lang.Object obj,
                                Reflect.Visitor<P> vis,
                                java.util.Set<Reflect.Ref<java.lang.Object>> ctx,
                                P par)
Calls a visitor for every field of an object

Parameters:
obj - the object
vis - the visitor
ctx - the reference context (or null if no context should be used)
par - a control parameter passed as last argument to the visitor
Returns:
true if the visitor never returned a FAIL status, false otherwise
See Also:
Reflect.Visitor, Reflect.VisitorState
